title: 2.1. Introduction to Jobs
intro: Now that we are familiar with the concept of Templates (See Templates Introduction) we shall introduce the concept of a Job in FieldLogs. In providing a platform for evidentary Field Data capture through Templates, we also provide a way to store securely the Data created. In FieldLogs we call this a Job.

blocks.content:
Data that is acquired during a period of time using the FieldLogs platform, whether on the web or on a mobile device, is generally referred to as a Job. Put another way, a Job consists of a GPS track, with optionally attached media Logs, that describes a period of acquisition that may or may not be based around a Template.

This provides a neat way to collect, organise and review all the periods of acquisition that a User does with their account.
Let's get a better idea about how a Job is created:

points.text: A User creates a Template for the first time, synchronizes and 'Runs' it on their mobile device using the FieldLogs app.
As soon as Running starts, a Job is created in the User's Job List.
From the point that the User starts the Running of a Template to the moment he/she stops Running (otherwise known as Acquisition), becomes the time bounds for the Job.
Once Acquisition has ended, the Job continues to be stored in the Job List for record. All activity including any media attachments as saved in the bounds of the Job.

blocks.content: Only one Job can be created simultaneously by an individual User.
